lines.text: Now. Some fool has invented an indestructible cloth. Where is he? How much does he want?

[Seeing the assistant's pen-lighter]
That's ingenious. May I?
Of course.

[Flicking the lighter on]
I wonder, can you tell me what is the ratio of ink to petrol?
I don't know.
Why can't you scientists leave things alone? What about my bit of washing when there's no washing to do?
Thank you Sidney. If you would've said "yes" I could've strangled you!

[describing Sidney]
... flotsam floating on the floodtide of profit.
[Daphne laughs at Sidney's suit]
What's funny about it?
It's just the suit. It looks as if it's wearing you.
It's still a bit luminous but it'll wear off.
Oh, no!
No?
No. Makes you look like a knight in shining armour.
Oh, it's a better job.
Well then?
Oh, yes, much.
More money?
I shan't actually get paid for it.
What? We'll see about that! Scab labour huh? The work committee better hear about this!
But I don't want to get paid.
Not want to? I don't care whether you want to get paid or not! You've got to get paid!
I don't care whether you want to get paid or not! You've got to get paid!
It shouldn't have done that.
